title: Old Newspaper Header Serif
content:
Hello.

Could someone help me find wich serif [or a close match] appears in the header of an early 1900s portuguese newspaper:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010607im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typophile_3512.jpg)

MyFont's WhatTheFont matched it with [Springfield](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010607/http:/http/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/springfield/springfield/), [Sorbonne](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010607/http:/http/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/sorbonne-bq/med-cnd/) and [Lotsa](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010607/http:/http/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aruban/lotsa-lotta/bold-condensed/) but I think there's too many differences to consider it an "acceptable" match.

Thanks in advance,  
Tiago
author: anarchitecton

comments.content: I think the closest you'll get with a digital font is [PL Latin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010607/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/latin_bold/?sample_text=O%20FIANDEIRO&sample_size=36&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1), also available in [Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010607/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/latin_compress/?sample_text=O%20FIANDEIRO&sample_size=48&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1) width.
